rules.natural: If event1 is prohibited, then event1 is approved.
In the event that event1 is prohibited, it is not the case that wine1 has high alcohol content.
Either the label of wine1 is approved or, if wine1 is filtered properly, then fermentation of wine1 being complete implies wine1 is ready for sale.
Either the alcohol content of wine1 is verified or the label of wine1 is not approved.
Either the origin of region1 is certified or the alcohol content of wine1 is not verified.

If wine1 has undergone natural clarification, then wine1 is not contaminated.
If sale of wine1 is authorized, then either wine1 has undergone chemical treatment or wine1 has undergone natural clarification.
Should wine1 be sold domestically, then sale of wine1 is authorized.
Either wine1 is sold domestically or wine1 is sold regionally.
When wine1 is sold regionally, then wine1 is sold nationally.
If wine1 is sold nationally, then wine1 is sold internationally.
If wine1 is sold internationally, then wine1 is sold as a specialty item.

Either region1 is a banned region or period1 is not a vintage year.
